text:
Good morning everyone! A quick question. I have a for loop.
`for file in files`
   `do something`
`end`
Since there are several hundreds of files, I would like to just test the first 10 and see if it works, how can I write this out in a compact way?
`for file,i in files,[1..10]`
   `do something`
`end`
Thanks!

elements.text: Good morning everyone! A quick question. I have a for loop.
Since there are several hundreds of files, I would like to just test the first 10 and see if it works, how can I write this out in a compact way?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

assuming that files is an array of files or filenames than
```for file in files[1:10]
    do something
end```

elements.text: assuming that files is an array of files or filenames than

for file in files[1:10]
    do something
end

text: You have to react with the bridge on the initial message. I'll react with a smiley face to indicate where it is.

text: Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/57434| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
